transportAdvice: Indianapolis is a car-centric city where walking is practical in the downtown core but less so in outer areas; a public bus network serves the city and suburbs, though coverage of tourist attractions is limited. Taxis and ride-hail vehicles are readily available downtown, and renting a car is advisable for exploring beyond the city center.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow and freezing temperatures; pack heavy winter layers.
Still cold with a mix of snow and rain; conditions begin to slowly improve toward month's end.
Early spring brings variable weather with warming days but still chilly nights and frequent rain.
Mild and pleasant but rainy; flowers bloom and outdoor activity picks up noticeably.
Warm and green with frequent spring showers; a lively month with outdoor events and the Indianapolis 500 build-up.
Warm to hot with rising humidity; expect occasional thunderstorms and plenty of sunshine between them.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity; afternoons can feel oppressive but evenings are lively.
Hot and humid similar to July; thunderstorms are possible but long sunny stretches are common.
Comfortable early fall temperatures with lower humidity; a pleasant time to explore the city outdoors.
Crisp autumn weather with colorful foliage; cool days and cold nights make layering essential.
Cold and increasingly grey with rain and the first hints of frost; a quieter month for tourism.
Cold winter conditions with possible snow; festive holiday atmosphere downtown brightens the short, dark days.
